Class ec.e.openers.ArrayOpener 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.e.openers.ArrayOpener 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.openers.Opener
           |
           +----ec.e.openers.RefOpener
                   |
                   +----ec.e.openers.ArrayOpener
public final class ArrayOpener
extends RefOpener
An Opener for one-dimensional Java arrays. Higher-dimesional arrays are described by ArrayOpeners whose element openers are also ArrayOpeners.

BOOLEAN_ARRAY
BYTE_ARRAY
CHAR_ARRAY
DOUBLE_ARRAY
FLOAT_ARRAY
INT_ARRAY
LONG_ARRAY
SHORT_ARRAY

commentary()
ArrayOpeners currently return as commentary an array of one String, "length", describing their fixed preface field.
decodeBody(Object, RtDecoder)
Assuming the preface has already been decoded, decode into the body of 'ref' from the decoder, and initialize 'ref' accordingly.
decodePreface(RtDecoder)
Decodes the object's preface from 'decoder', then makes and returns the object to be registered for decoded pointers to point to.
elementOpener()
Opener for the array's element type
encodeBody(Object, RtEncoder)
Assuming the preface has already been encoded, encode the body of 'ref' onto encoder.
encodePreface(Object, RtEncoder)
Encode preface information for 'ref' onto 'encoder'.
get(Object, int)
Given that 'array' is of the type opened by this ArrayOpener, what is the index'th element? Result is wrapped as necessary.
length(Object)
Given that 'array' is of the type opened by this ArrayOpener, what is its length?
put(Object, int, Object)
Given that 'array' is of the type opened by this ArrayOpener, set the index'th element to newElement, unwrapping as necessary.
signature()
An array's signature is the same as it openerID: '[' followed by the element type's signature
toString()
Returns a String that represents the value of this Object.
